CatDescriptText: Mr. Donald McCreary, 2263 Somers Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 2, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that one political party should be in control of all the offices in the city, county, and state?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that its good. For two or more different political parties to be in at the same time, there would be a different pull.  If one political party wins all the offices, it is entitled to hold them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Donald McCreary, wearing striped buttoned down shirt, dark cap, herringbone pants, light colored varsity style jacket with patch inscribed "Phalanx 5," standing on sidewalk next to tire swing
